title: BBC Verify: What satellite images reveal about Myanmar's quake
snippets: Myanmar's military government says at least 2,000 people were killed in last week's 7.7 magnitude quake.
summary: Myanmar's military government reported that a 7.7 magnitude earthquake last week resulted in the deaths of at least 2,000 people.
titles: BBC Verify: What satellite images reveal about Myanmar's quake

title: Shock Le Pen verdict rocks French far right
snippets: The far-right figurehead has been barred from running for public office for five years, throwing her plans into disarray.
summary: A far-right political figure has been banned from seeking any public office for the next five years, disrupting her future political ambitions.
titles: Shock Le Pen verdict rocks French far right

title: US says law applies to 'all parties' in Gaza
snippets: The deaths of 15 people including paramedics in a convoy have been blamed on Israel's military.
summary: A convoy, including paramedics, was attacked, resulting in the deaths of 15 people. This incident has been attributed to Israel's military.
titles: US says law applies to 'all parties' in Gaza

title: University student targeted by Trump leaves the US
snippets: British citizen Momodou Taal had his visa revoked due to protest activities opposing Israel.
summary: The UK government revoked the visa of British citizen Momodou Taal due to his involvement in protests against Israel.
titles: University student targeted by Trump leaves the US

title: Roof ripped off home as severe storms and tornadoes hit central US
snippets: Several states have been hit with heavy rain, hail and damaging winds, with storms expected to continue in some areas through Thursday.
summary: Several states are experiencing severe weather conditions, including heavy rain, hail, and damaging winds. The storms are forecasted to persist in some regions until Thursday.
titles: Roof ripped off home as severe storms and tornadoes hit central US

title: Breaking down the 2025 McDonald's All American girls' game
snippets: Everything you need to know about the 2025 McDonald's All American girls' game on Tuesday (6:30 p.m. ET, ESPN2).
summary: The 2025 McDonald's All American girls' game is scheduled for Tuesday at 6:30 p.m. ET and will be broadcast on ESPN2.
titles: Breaking down the 2025 McDonald's All American girls' game

title: In a massive setback for UCLA, 7-3 center Aday Mara will not return next season
snippets: UCLA 7-foot-3 center Aday Mara, who proved to be one of the biggest game-changers for the Bruins last season, has decided to leave Westwood.
summary: Aday Mara, UCLA's 7-foot-3 center known for significantly impacting the team's performance last season, has chosen to leave the university.
titles: In a massive setback for UCLA, 7-3 center Aday Mara will not return next season

title: UConn returns to Final Four behind Bueckers' 31
snippets: Behind 31 points and six assists, Paige Bueckers lifted No. 2 seed UConn to a 78-64 win over No. 1 seed USC in the Spokane 4 regional final, clinching the team's 16th Final Four appearance in 17 years and 24th overall.
summary: Paige Bueckers scored 31 points and provided six assists, leading the No. 2 seed UConn to a 78-64 victory over No. 1 seed USC in the Spokane 4 regional final. This win secures UConn's 16th Final Four appearance in the last 17 years and their 24th in the team's history.
titles: UConn returns to Final Four behind Bueckers' 31

title: Sources: Red Sox LHP Crochet gets $170M deal
snippets: Left-hander Garrett Crochet and the Red Sox are in agreement on a six-year, $170 million contract extension, sources told ESPN, keeping the 25-year-old ace with the organization that traded for him this winter to lead its rotation.
summary: Garrett Crochet, a 25-year-old left-handed pitcher, has agreed to a six-year, $170 million contract extension with the Boston Red Sox. This deal secures his position as a leading pitcher for the team, following his trade to the Red Sox this winter.
titles: Sources: Red Sox LHP Crochet gets $170M deal

title: Sources: Miles to forgo WNBA draft, enter portal
snippets: After her team's exit in the Sweet 16 on Saturday, Notre Dame guard Olivia Miles has decided to forgo the WNBA draft, despite being projected as the No. 2 overall selection, and enter the transfer portal, sources told ESPN's Shams Charania on Monday.
summary: Notre Dame guard Olivia Miles, projected as the No. 2 pick for the WNBA draft, will enter the transfer portal instead of joining the draft, following her team's Sweet 16 exit. This decision was reported by ESPN's Shams Charania.
titles: Sources: Miles to forgo WNBA draft, enter portal

title: Trump has promised tariff ‘liberation day’. Americans aren’t so sure
snippets: Even the president’s supporters are sceptical of new levies to be imposed on trading partners on April 2
summary: The president plans to impose new levies on trading partners starting April 2, a move that has drawn skepticism even from his supporters.
titles: Trump has promised tariff ‘liberation day’. Americans aren’t so sure

title: French court leaves Marine Le Pen’s political career on the brink
snippets: Far-right leader has limited legal options as ruling fires starting gun on race to succeed Emmanuel Macron
summary: A far-right leader faces restricted legal choices following a decision that initiates the competition to succeed Emmanuel Macron as France's president.
titles: French court leaves Marine Le Pen’s political career on the brink

title: How a $1.4tn Trump trade war could unfold
snippets: Econometric study models global fallout from tariff retaliation, including dramatic rise in US prices
summary: An econometric study has modeled the global effects of tariff retaliation, finding that such actions could lead to a significant increase in prices within the United States.
titles: How a $1.4tn Trump trade war could unfold

title: Anime lessons in the limits of AI
snippets: Generative images show us the risks of endowing the technology with magical powers
summary: Generative images highlight the dangers of attributing excessive capabilities to technology, suggesting a need for caution in how we perceive and utilize these advancements.
titles: Anime lessons in the limits of AI

title: DeepMind slows down research releases in battle to keep competitive edge
snippets: Google’s AI arm led by Demis Hassabis makes it harder for its researchers to publish studies in major change in approach
summary: Google's AI division, headed by Demis Hassabis, has implemented stricter policies for its researchers regarding the publication of their studies. This marks a significant shift in the division's approach to sharing research findings.
titles: DeepMind slows down research releases in battle to keep competitive edge

title: Clinical trial unearths hidden hypertension with automated searches of health records
snippets: A trial of 648 patients found that the new automated method and intervention strategy resulted in nearly four times as many diagnoses and treatment plans for high blood pressure compared with traditional office-based health care visits.
summary: A study with 648 participants revealed that a new automated method for diagnosing and creating treatment plans for high blood pressure was nearly four times more effective than traditional office visits.
titles: Clinical trial unearths hidden hypertension with automated searches of health records

title: Discovery of Quina technology challenges view of ancient human development in East Asia
snippets: Researchers have uncovered a complete Quina technological system in the Longtan site in southwest China. The discovery challenges the widely held perception that the Middle Paleolithic period was mostly static in East Asia.
summary: Researchers have discovered a complete Quina technological system at the Longtan site in southwest China, indicating significant technological development during the Middle Paleolithic period. This finding challenges the previous belief that this era was largely unchanging in East Asia.
titles: Discovery of Quina technology challenges view of ancient human development in East Asia

title: Study shows groundwater gains in Arizona yet climate risks still threaten water supply
snippets: A combination of water management practices has contributed to notable groundwater gains in Central Arizona despite the region dealing with long-term water stress, according to a new study.
summary: A new study reveals that Central Arizona has seen significant groundwater improvements due to various water management strategies, despite facing ongoing water stress challenges.
titles: Study shows groundwater gains in Arizona yet climate risks still threaten water supply

title: My robot therapist: The ethics of AI mental health chatbots for kids
snippets: AI mental health apps may offer a cheap and accessible way to fill the gaps in the overstretched U.S. mental health care system, but ethics experts warn that we need to be thoughtful about how we use them, especially with children.
summary: AI mental health apps could provide an affordable solution to the strained U.S. mental health care system. However, ethics experts caution the importance of careful consideration in their application, particularly when it comes to children.
titles: My robot therapist: The ethics of AI mental health chatbots for kids

title: Scientists pioneer method to tackle 'forever chemicals'
snippets: Researchers have developed an innovative solution to a pressing environmental challenge: removing and destroying per- and polyfluoroalkyl substances (PFAS), commonly called 'forever chemicals.' A new study unveils a method that not only eliminates PFAS from water systems but also transforms waste into high-value graphene, offering a cost-effective and sustainable approach to environmental remediation.
summary: Researchers have created a method to remove 'forever chemicals' (PFAS) from water, converting the waste into valuable graphene. This sustainable solution addresses environmental pollution while providing a cost-effective approach to producing high-value graphene.
titles: Scientists pioneer method to tackle 'forever chemicals'
